description: Born in Ukraine, Todros Geller immigrated to Chicago where he attended the School of the Art Institute and became an influential educator. In this work, Geller reflects on the complex blending of immigrant traditions, such as his Jewish upbringing and the modern culture of early 20th-century Chicago—a collision of “strange worlds.” The figure’s posture and expression suggest his resistance to—and perseverance in—a changing world.
artist_info:
Todros Geller (American
born Vinnytsia, Russian Empire, now Ukraine, 1889–1949)
title: Strange Worlds
